intro: Atopoglossum ekmanii, commonly known as the Ekman's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered with a fine layer of white pubescence. Due to its restricted habitat and rarity, it is considered an endangered species.
